title: Ticket #1267: NMI Builds for window should also make MSI packages
description: NMI Builds should produce MSI packages for window. #571 worked towards this and I'm finishing it.
remarks:
2010-Mar-09 10:51:37 by psilord:
Meh, my checkin last night didn't work because the environment variables for NMI builds are vastly different than builds done while logged into a windows machine. I have some avenues to fix it and will iterate some branch builds today.

2010-Mar-09 14:31:52 by psilord:
With Todd's help, I've been hacking on it. I think I'm very close.

2010-Mar-10 13:42:48 by psilord:
This task just. won't. die.

2010-Mar-17 10:23:47 by psilord:
I was unsuccessful in getting this to work. :(

The final error I could not get around was: 

SYNTAX CHECK'S OUTPUT
~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~
CScript Error: Loading your settings failed. (Access is denied. )

This link, especially step 5, seems to be something important that I need to do, but it doesn't seem to have an effect when I do it.

The things from #571 (and more) were implemented in V7_4-branch and master:

  • load_profile is true in the nmi submit file glue
  • Commented out in nmi_glue/build/remote_task is the means by which dopackaging.bat should be run.
  • MSI (and more) env vars are set in msconfig/installer/mm.cmd.
  • The env vars TMP and TEMP are automatically set to meaningful values in nmi_glue/build/remote_task.
  • I created a file called msconfig/installer/msikeys.reg which holds the apparently needed registry keys for CScript. There is a commented out line in msconfig/installer/Makefile which puts the keys into the registry. I didn't check to see if the registry keys actually showed up or not. I don't know how.

I did all this, but couldn't ever figure out the problem without spending an unreasonable amount of more time.

If you want to test it, then (on V7_4-branch or master):

  • Comment in the dopackaging step in nmi_glue/build/remote_task.
  • Comment in the regedit line in msconfig/installer/Makefile.
  • Submit your workspace build.

Good Luck.

2011-Mar-30 14:13:26 by psilord:
It seems that it is impossible for this to work. The three resident windows experts and one upset unix programmer couldn't figure it out.

2011-Mar-30 14:22:20 by ziliang:
Actually, I do believe we got this working, but it's turned off right now.
derived_tickets: #1529   condor_nmi_submit incorrectly tries to load windows profile
check_ins:
2010-Mar-15 12:03   Check-in [17630]: Sadly, I was unable to get our nightlies to produce the MSI package. :( I've commented out the attempting of it in this script. Hopefully later another crack can be taken at it. Ticket #1267 holds all of what I know about what was tried and hypotheses why it might not work. (By Pete Keller )
2010-Mar-15 11:54   Check-in [17628]: In order to try and get makemsi, which needs cscript, working, I add a registry key with regedit. Unfortunately, this seems to have no effect on the non-workingness of cscript, but the internet insists this is the right thing to do. So I'm leaving it here, but commenting it out until we figure it out [...] (By Pete Keller )
2010-Mar-12 11:53   Check-in [17449]: Fixed a control flow error in the output of this script when it fails. This is for #1267. (By Peter Keller )
2010-Mar-12 11:30   Check-in [17448]: Fix the NMI glue to set TEMP properly under a windows build. NMI was setting it to something very wrong, and the windows build was picking it up and using it. Some new code went in recently that caused this to suddenly become a problem. [...] (By Pete Keller )
2010-Mar-10 16:09   Check-in [17445]: Fix the NMI glue to set TEMP properly under a windows build. NMI was setting it to something very wrong, and the windows build was picking it up and using it. Some new code went in recently that caused this to suddenly become a problem. [...] (By Pete Keller )
2010-Mar-10 10:34   Check-in [17423]: After some serious debugging, I think the real change to enable the msi installer pass in NMI that actually needed to happen was simply that the environment variables TMP and TEMP needed to be set up in mm.cmd just for the make msi installer program. I was setting those tmp directories far to early [...] (By Peter Keller )
2010-Mar-09 13:45   Check-in [17421]: Added some double quotes around the processing of %TEMP% and %TMP%. #1267 (By Peter Keller )
2010-Mar-09 12:13   Check-in [17419]: Turns out I only need the TMP and TEMP variables. The others are set in installer/mm.cmd. #1267 (By Pete Keller )
2010-Mar-09 11:49   Check-in [17417]: Another iteration of getting MSI builds to work on windows. #1267 (By Pete Keller )
2010-Mar-08 16:28   Check-in [17414]: No guts, no glory. Add MSI packaging to NMI builds. #1267 (By Peter Keller )
